result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

NOT CALLED ON THE RECORD:
Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez appeared by video for Marshal Lashawn Murff. Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff appeared by video. 
Attorney Gutierrez requests a plea and sentencing date in January.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Warrant signed by Judge Schimel cancelled on 10-13-22
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee County Jail with fax confirmation

Case called at 10:23 a.m.
Attorney Melissa Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Marshal Lashawn Murff.  
Defendant Marshal Lashawn Murff appeared by video, in custody at Milwaukee County Jail.
Court will quash the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receiving a copy of the Criminal Complaint, waives its reading, enters a Not Guilty Plea.
Court sets a Signature Bond in the amount of $500.00
Conditions:  No new law violations
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
